full_text: Asked @SimonHarrisTD why public investment per student in Ireland is less than per racehorse and why student fees should be abolished, particularly under #COVID19.No serious commitment from him to address this. #nofees full video on my Facebook page https://t.co/H8RFvb7J9w

Rally to support #Debenhams workers at Henry St at 1pm. Occupation in Cork continues, Henry St workers were arrested but now released. Interesting how fast the state reacts to stop workers fighting for their rights, not so quick to stop companies abusing workers @pb4p

#Debenhams workers this morning occupied stores at Henry St, Dublin & Patrick St, Cork. Fair play to them! 150 days on & a totally insulting “offer” from the liquidators - this is how to respond. @pb4p supports this action fully. @ingridmileyRTE  @morningireland @NewstalkFM

@PadraigMacL disingenuous Padraig -for years, all parties & groups had slot each in order of size in first round of #Dail debate, so all voices heard and bigger parties got extra time after that. This excludes @SocDems, @pb4p & Ind groups from opening & most important round-ur dividing left

Much bigger issue though is that thousands of musicians, arts & ents workers & taxi drivers seeing PUP cut off or cut down, whipped back to work with “actively seeking work” provision when no or little work exists. These workers need income support, instead being punished @pb4p https://t.co/x0NACixyGH

@Gombeenisland @pb4p @rtenews Totally agree with you friend. Class bias is rife & must be challenged. It is deeply corrosive - I’d like to think @pb4p are trying to challenge this bias in what we are doing but maybe you are right and we should call it out more explicitly. Either way, I think you are bang on.

@mailsanchu @pb4p @rtenews My point is simple, if non-essential travel is not allowed, it should be stopped for all not just those on PUP payments. Also gov should not have Advice on their website saying it’s ok to holiday to some countries but penalise one group for following that advice but not others.

@conorgalvin @pb4p @rtenews Honestly Conor I agree but you can’t say we’ll penalise some for not staying in Ireland but won’t penalise the rest-it’s all or nothing, if we’re all in it together,otherwise the legitimacy of public health advice falls apart.This action will undermine  the public health effort.

@conorgalvin @pb4p @rtenews Agree but restrictions must apply to all or to none. Restrictions are meaningless if they only apply to those on covid payment and it gets even worse when DFA says explicitly that non-essential restriction doesnt apply to some countries but gov apply it to all PUP recipients
@mailsanchu @pb4p @rtenews I thought we were all in it together. You think it’s ok that some people penalised for non-essential travel but others are not? Seriously?

@conorgalvin @pb4p @rtenews Sure but travel restrictions should apply to everyone not just those who lost jobs cos of #COVIDー19 . Also Official DFA website says explicitly the general advice on non-essential travel doesnt apply to so-called green list, so different standard being applied to PUP recipients!

This is truly grotesque! People who through no fault of their own lost their job because of #COVIDー19 are singled out for financial penalty for going on holidays. Travel restrictions are either for everyone or for no-one. So much for we’re “all in it together”. @pb4p @rtenews https://t.co/27MnwDHnOe
@political_dub @pb4p Because it refers to the “general advisory” in black bold at the top of the page, not the exemption further down.

@political_dub @pb4p A) the advice on DFA is contradictory B) why should penalties for acting contrary to official travel advice be limited to people who already suffered through no fault of their own the loss of their job because of #COVIDー19 ?

This is grotesque! Govt gives mixed messages about foreign travel ie.say on the DFA website that the restriction on non-essential travel does not apply to “green list” countries,but then punish only the people who lost jobs because of #COVIDー19 for following their advice. @pb4p https://t.co/KF0HO9Iuzj

@_jackhy Socialism isn’t a country-it’s movement to put the needs of people before profit & war across the world. Clearly, that has not been achieved. To blame Lenin for the crimes of Stalin is like blaming James Connolly for Magdalene Laundries & industrial schools. It’s just dishonesty

@_jackhy Lenin’s last will and testament called for Stalin to be removed from office. The whites launched the war against the soviet republic with murderous anti-Jewish pogroms and propaganda being a central part of their offensive. The first woman minister in the world ever was a red.
@_jackhy I think you’ll find Lenin was dead by 1924. It was the monster Stalin who killed millions. Historical fact check always useful.
